results.title: Napoleon (1994) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Herald Ace, Film Australia, Michael Bourchier and Mario Andreacchio
results.brief_description: This live action Australian adventure follows an adorable pup on a cross-country search for the dingoes who comprise his doggy roots. Though the cocky young puppy’s real name is Muffin, he prefers to think of himself as Napoleon, a conquering warrior. Napoleon gets more than he bargained for when he is carried aloft in a makeshift air balloon into unknown territory. Embarking on a journey that will turn any pup into a warrior, he dares to go where no pup has gone before; discovering unknown lands and meeting some real friends along the way. [VHS 309191]

results.title: Mystic river
results.creator_credit: Malpaso Company, Robert Lorenz, Judie G. Hoyt and Clint Eastwood
results.brief_description: An intense drama from director Clint Eastwood, about three childhood friends whose paths meet in adult life when one of their teenage children is murdered. Sean Penn (Jimmy) plays the anguished father of the murdered girl (winning an Academy Award for Best Actor for his performance), with Kevin Bacon (Sean) as the police detective investigating, and Tim Robbins as the troubled suspect Dave (also an Academy Award winning performance). Based on the novel by Dennis Lehane. Cast also includes Marcia Gay Harden, Laurence Fishburne and Laura Linney.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Malpaso Company, Robert Lorenz, Judie G. Hoyt and Clint Eastwood

results.title: Mystic pizza
results.creator_credit: Samuel Goldwyn Company, Mark Levinson, Scott Rosenfelt and Donald Petrie
results.brief_description: Friends Kat, Daisy and Jojo share their insecurities, dreams and aspirations as they work at Mystic Pizza, a successful pizzeria in small town Mystic. Kat (Annabeth Gish) is sensible and intelligent, holding down 4 part time jobs to finance her way through next year’s astronomy course and about to become involved with a married man. Daisy (Julia Roberts in her first major screen role), Kat’s sister, is promiscuous and sexy, arguing with her mother who wants her to “calm down” and involved with rich kid Charlie in a possible rags to riches romance. Jojo (Lili Taylor) is engaged to fishmonger Bill but is suffering from pre-wedding jitters and her healthy libido is at odds with Bill’s catholic conscience. All three of them want to make something of their lives - perhaps get out of Mystic, and all three of them are determined to remain friends forever. Cast also includes William R Moses, Vincent D’Onofrio, Adam Storke and Conchata Ferrell.

results.title: Mystery train
results.creator_credit: MTI productions, Jim Stark and Jim Jarmusch
results.brief_description: Mystery Train is a trilogy of films all centering on a group of strangers who arrive in Memphis, Tennessee, a city dominated by the historical presence of rock ‘n’ roll, and in particular, the memory of Elvis Presley.

constellations_other.name: Remix and resistance (Since I left you)
constellations_other.description: The Avalanches' music videos are part of a long artistic tradition of reappropriation as a means of reframing perception.

results.creator_credit_for_label: MTI productions, Jim Stark and Jim Jarmusch
results.description: Mystery Train is a trilogy of films all centering on a group of strangers who arrive in Memphis, Tennessee, a city dominated by the historical prescence of rock ‘n’ roll and in particular the memory of Elvis Presley. As in all of Jarmush’s films the pleasure is in his ability to create an identification with characters who are far from the glamorous stereotypes of traditional Hollywood cinema. But as becomes clear in the cross-cutting between the various threads of the film, each individual displays both eccentricities and talents which enable them to transcend the limitations of social roles. Youki Kudoh and Mastoshi Nagase are excellent as a hip Japanese couple making a pilgrimage to Presley’s grave and the rest of the cast are also outstanding. Excellent cameos from Clash singer Joe Strummer and a very funny wild performance by blues veteran Screamin Jay Hawkins. Narrated by Tom Waits and featuring the music of John Lurie, Roy Orbinson, the Bar Kays and Rufus Thomas.

details.label: Subject categories
display_values: Feature films → Feature films - United States

results.title: My way home
results.brief_description: This final part of Bill Douglas’ trilogy takes Jamie through adolescence into adulthood, from a children’s home to the RAF in Egypt. A brief return to his father’s home, where his ideas of attending art school are rebuffed by his stepmother, is followed by various menial jobs, until his conscription into the RAF, where he is befriended by Robert, who introduces him to art and literature and friendship. A subjective epilogue returns to Newcastle, but now the images are bleached out, as if the pain has been washed away, and we are left with the triumphant concluding image of a tree in full bloom.

results.title: My Sweet Little Village = Vesnicko Ma Strediskova
results.creator_credit: Barrandov Studios, Jan Suster and Jiri Menzel
results.brief_description: My Sweet Little Village examines with simple affection the affairs - comic, sad, quirky and downright ordinary - of a village collective farm in Czechoslovakia. The story begins and ends with a marvellous comic pair - truckie’s offsider, Otek, and his long suffering workmate. There is not a solitary political utterance to be heard, but the film still manages to subtly convey the graft and corruption permeating every level of Czech society.

results.title: My own private Idaho [DVD]
results.creator_credit: New Visions Pictures, Laurie Parker and Gus Van Sant
results.brief_description: Explores the place where the need to survive and the need to be loved and belong meet personal choices in the transition to adulthood of two street hustlers. An indictment of how we exploit each other sexually, emotionally and financially in the ‘90’s and the need to rediscover compassion for the frailties, failings and weaknesses of others. River Phoenix and Keanu Reeves play two young male prostitutes trying to survive homeless on the streets of Portland. A dazzling combination of realist street cinema, experimental narrative, and a homoerotic homage to Shakespeare, “My Own Private Idaho” is a stand-out, confronting independent film.

results.title: My man Godfrey
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures and Gregory La Cava
results.brief_description: This is one of the classic screwball comedies of its time. An heiress (Carole Lombard), hires a butler (William Powell) after finding him on a scavenger hunt. She and her family are under the impression that he is a tramp without a job. He decides to teach “High Society” that money isn’t everything, and in the tradition of screwball comedy gets his girl as well as making his point. The film was unsuccessful at the Academy Awards despite six nominations but remains one of the best of its genre. Based on the novel by Eric Hatch.

results.title: My little chickadee
results.brief_description: Mae West is teamed with W.C. Fields in this classic comedy filled with Wild West action and lusty humour. The familiar Westian swagger, drawl, wisecracks and innuendos are all included, likewise the typical Field’s routines and quick-triggered comments. The pairing of the two stars was at the time considered to ensure a box-office success, but it would see sparks fly with the clashing of two great super-egos. However a West-Fields non-aggression pact was inspired in part by the fact that the two players wrote their own screen story. Scenes in which the pair work together are reduced to a minimum with the script set up being a continual series of episodes, first with West and then with Fields. The story is simple; Flower Belle Lee, returning from a complete course in a Chicago dance hall, has a way with men. A masked bandit falls in love with her, which eventually leads to her being drummed out of town. Meeting Cuthbert J. Twillie on the train on the way out, she believes him to have money, and promotes a fake wedding ceremony. The pair hit the next fronteir settlement, where Twillie becomes the sherrif, and West tosses her charms around rather freely.

results.title: My life to live = Vivre sa vie: film en douze tableaux
results.creator_credit: Films de la Pleiade, Pierre Braunberger and Jean-Luc Godard
results.brief_description: Anna Karina is a young French woman, Nana, who casually drifts into prostitution. Separating his story into twelve scenes which follow the classic structure of the nineteenth century novel (“Vivre Sa Vie” is a very loose adaptation of the Emile Zola classic “Nana”) Jean-Luc Godard constructs a film that is as much an essay on sexual exchange, and a study of Anna Karina’s beautiful face, as it is a straightforward narrative of a young woman destroyed by exploitative men. “Vivre Sa Vie” was a breakthrough film for Godard, one which saw him not only experimenting formally with manipulation of sound and image, but also beginning to fracture narrative and developing his unique approach to using the film medium for philosophical exploration. What startles now on revisiting the film is how neither his techniques nor his speculations have dated. If anything, the film’s contemplation and examination of prostitution, linking the exchange in bodies to both consumerism and to male oppression, can be seen as a precursor to the explorations and analyses of second-wave feminism. The film also explores how the very apparatus of cinema can be utilised to commodify and abstract the female into object. But in one emotionally stunning scene, where a dejected Nana, no money in her pocket, contemplates the suffering of Falconetti as Joan of Arc in Carl Dreyer’s classic silent film, “Vivre Sa Vie” asks us to consider the transcendent possibilities of art to transform culture and economies. The luminous black and white photography is by Raoul Coutard and the simple, elegant music by Michel Legrand. The films full title in English is “My Life to Live: A Film in Twelve Scenes”. In French with English subtitles.
